content: A father wakes up in a car, discovering he has been bitten. His wife is already transformed into a zombie.
The father realizes he is infected and has limited time before he transforms. His baby is in the backseat.
The father looks at a map, planning his route. He knows he must get his baby to safety before he turns.
The father creates a baby carrier using a backpack, positioning the baby on his back with a bottle of food attached to a stick.
He writes a note and attaches it to the baby carrier, explaining the situation and asking for help.
The father begins walking through the Australian outback, following a scent trail left by survivors.
As he walks, the infection progresses. The father's movements become more zombie-like.
The father follows the scent markers - pieces of cloth tied to trees - left by the survivors.
He continues walking, the baby safely on his back, feeding from the bottle attached to the stick.
The father's transformation accelerates. He stumbles but keeps moving forward, driven by instinct to protect the baby.
He reaches a river and crosses it, still following the scent trail toward the survivors' camp.
The father arrives at the survivors' camp. He is now fully transformed into a zombie.
The survivors see the zombie approaching and prepare to defend themselves.
One survivor notices the baby on the zombie's back and the note attached to the carrier.
The survivors read the note and understand the father's sacrifice. They realize he brought the baby to safety.
The survivors carefully remove the baby from the zombie father's back, keeping the father at bay.
The baby is safe. The survivors take the child, understanding the father's final act of love.
The survivors bury the zombie father, honoring his sacrifice and the love that drove him to save his child.
The baby is now in the care of the survivors, safe because of the father's selfless journey.
The story ends with the baby safe, a testament to a father's love that transcended even death.
